liver_info_markdown.English:
### What are Liver Function Tests?
Liver function tests are blood tests that measure different enzymes and proteins in your blood to help evaluate how well your liver is working.

### Common Liver Function Tests

| Test | What it Measures | Why it's Important |
|------|------------------|-------------------|
| Total Bilirubin | Yellow substance produced during the breakdown of red blood cells | Elevated levels may indicate liver damage or disease |
| Direct Bilirubin | The portion of bilirubin that is directly measured | Can help differentiate between different types of liver or bile duct problems |
| Alkaline Phosphatase | Enzyme found in the liver and bones | Elevated levels may indicate bile duct blockage or certain bone disorders |
| ALT (Alamine Aminotransferase) | Enzyme found primarily in the liver | Sensitive indicator of liver cell damage |
| AST (Aspartate Aminotransferase) | Enzyme found in the liver and other tissues | Elevated in liver damage, but less specific than ALT |
| Total Proteins | All proteins in the blood | Can indicate nutritional status or liver function |
| Albumin | The main protein made by the liver | Low levels can indicate chronic liver disease or malnutrition |
| Albumin/Globulin Ratio | Ratio of albumin to other proteins | Can help differentiate between causes of abnormal protein levels |

### Factors Affecting Liver Health
- Alcohol consumption
- Viral hepatitis (B, C)
- Fatty liver disease
- Certain medications
- Autoimmune conditions
- Genetic disorders

### When to Consult a Doctor
Consult a healthcare provider if you experience:
- Yellowing of skin or eyes (jaundice)
- Abdominal pain or swelling
- Chronic fatigue
- Nausea or vomiting
- Dark urine or pale stools
